com.cloudera.oryx.als.serving

Class ServerRecommender

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cloudera.oryx.als.serving.ServerRecommender
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    OryxRecommender, Closeable, AutoCloseable

    public final class ServerRecommender
extends Object
implements OryxRecommender, Closeable

    The core implementation of OryxRecommender that lies inside the Serving Layer.

    Author:
    Sean Owen

      • ingest

        public void ingest(File file)
            throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: OryxRecommender
        "Uploads" a series of new associations to the recommender; this is like a bulk version of OryxRecommender.setPreference(String, String, float). The input file should be in CSV format, where each line is of the form userID,itemID,value. Note that the file may be compressed. If it is make sure that its name reflects its compression -- gzip ending in ".gz", zip ending in ".zip"
        Specified by:
        ingest in interface OryxRecommender
        Parameters:
        file - CSV file to ingest, possibly compressed.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • recommend

        public List<IDValue> recommend(String userID,
                               int howMany,
                               boolean considerKnownItems,
                               Rescorer rescorer)
                        throws NoSuchUserException,
                               NotReadyException
        Specified by:
        recommend in interface OryxRecommender
        Parameters:
        userID - user for which recommendations are to be computed
        howMany - desired number of recommendations
        considerKnownItems - if true, items that the user is already associated to are candidates for recommendation. Normally this is false.
        rescorer - rescoring function used to modify association strengths before ranking results
        Returns:
        List of recommended IDValues, ordered from most strongly recommend to least
        Throws:
        NoSuchUserException - if the user is not known in the model
        NotReadyException - if the recommender has no model available yet

      • recommendToMany

        public List<IDValue> recommendToMany(String[] userIDs,
                                     int howMany,
                                     boolean considerKnownItems,
                                     Rescorer rescorer)
                              throws NoSuchUserException,
                                     NotReadyException
        Description copied from interface: OryxRecommender
        Recommends to a group of users all at once. It takes into account their tastes equally and produces one set of recommendations that is deemed most suitable to them as a group. It is otherwise identical to OryxRecommender.recommend(String, int, boolean, Rescorer).
        Specified by:
        recommendToMany in interface OryxRecommender
        Throws:
        NoSuchUserException - if none of userIDs exist in the model. Otherwise, unknown users are ignored.
        NotReadyException
        See Also:
        OryxRecommender.recommend(String, int, boolean, Rescorer)

      • popularRepresentativeItems

        public List<String> popularRepresentativeItems()
                                        throws NotReadyException
        Description copied from interface: OryxRecommender
        This is an experimental novelty method, that constructs a list of items that is in some way representative of the range of items in the model. That is, the items will tend to be different from each other, and popular. Specifically, it is "recommending" one item to each of the latent features in the model.
        Specified by:
        popularRepresentativeItems in interface OryxRecommender
        Returns:
        a list of item IDs, one for each latent feature in the model
        Throws:
        NotReadyException - if the implementation has no usable model yet

      • estimatePreference

        public float estimatePreference(String userID,
                                String itemID)
                         throws NotReadyException
        Specified by:
        estimatePreference in interface OryxRecommender
        Parameters:
        userID - user ID whose preference is to be estimated
        itemID - item ID to estimate preference for
        Returns:
        an estimate of the strength of the association between the user and item. These values are the same as will be returned from recommend(String, int). They are opaque values and have no interpretation other than that larger means stronger. The values are typically in the range [0,1] but are not guaranteed to be so. Note that 0 will be returned if the user or item is not known in the data.
        Throws:
        NotReadyException - if the recommender has no model available yet

      • estimatePreferences

        Description copied from interface: OryxRecommender
        A bulk version of OryxRecommender.estimatePreference(String, String), suitable for computing many estimates at once. The return values correspond, in order, to the item IDs provided, in order.
        Specified by:
        estimatePreferences in interface OryxRecommender

        OryxRecommender.estimatePreference(String, String)

      • estimateForAnonymous

        public float estimateForAnonymous(String toItemID,
                                  String[] itemIDs)
                           throws NotReadyException,
                                  NoSuchItemException
        Description copied from interface: OryxRecommender

        A version of OryxRecommender.estimatePreference(String, String) that, like OryxRecommender.recommendToAnonymous(String[], float[], int), operates on "anonymous" users -- defined not by a previously known set of data, but data given in the request.

        This differs from OryxRecommender.mostSimilarItems(String, int), conceptually, in that it is for recommending to a user that is defined only by a given set of item interactions. It is appropriate for recommendation-like uses. Technically speaking, this method creates a user vector formed by projecting the given items together into the latent feature space, and then recommending to that user vector (high dot product items), which is slightly different from the other method.

        Specified by:
        estimateForAnonymous in interface OryxRecommender
        Parameters:
        toItemID - item for which the anonymous user's strength of interaction is to be estimated
        itemIDs - item IDs that the anonymous user has interacted with
        Throws:
        NotReadyException
        NoSuchItemException
        See Also:
        OryxRecommender.recommendToAnonymous(String[], float[], int), OryxRecommender.mostSimilarItems(String, int)

      • setPreference

        public void setPreference(String userID,
                          String itemID)
        Calls setPreference(String, String, float) with value 1.0.
        Specified by:
        setPreference in interface OryxRecommender
        See Also:
        OryxRecommender.setPreference(String, String, float)

      • setPreference

        public void setPreference(String userID,
                          String itemID,
                          float value)
        Description copied from interface: OryxRecommender

        Adds to a user-item preference, or association. This is called in response to some action that indicates the user has a stronger association to an item, like a click or purchase. It is intended to be called many times for a user and item, as more actions are observed that associate the two. That is, this calls adds to rather than sets the association.

        To "undo" associations, call this method with negative values, or see OryxRecommender.removePreference(String, String).

        Value is not a rating, but a strength indicator. It may be negative. Its magnitude should correspond to the degree to which an observed event suggests an association between a user and item. A value twice as big should correspond to an event that suggests twice as strong an association.

        For example, a click on a video might result in a call with value 1.0. Watching half of the video might result in another call adding value 3.0. Finishing the video, another 3.0. Liking or sharing the video, an additional 10.0. Clicking away from a video within 10 seconds might result in a -3.0.

        Specified by:
        setPreference in interface OryxRecommender
        Parameters:
        userID - user involved in the new preference
        itemID - item involved
        value - strength value

      • removePreference

        public void removePreference(String userID,
                             String itemID)
        Description copied from interface: OryxRecommender

        This method will remove an item from the user's set of known items, making it eligible for recommendation again. If the user has no more items, this method will remove the user too, such that new calls to OryxRecommender.recommend(String, int) for example will fail with NoSuchUserException.

        It does not affect any user-item association strengths.

        Contrast with calling OryxRecommender.setPreference(String, String, float) with a negative value, which merely records a negative association between the user and item.

        Specified by:
        removePreference in interface OryxRecommender

                                      int howMany)

      • mostSimilarItems

        public List<IDValue> mostSimilarItems(String itemID,
                                      int howMany,
                                      PairRescorer rescorer)
                               throws NoSuchItemException,
                                      NotReadyException
        One-argument version of mostSimilarItems(String[], int, PairRescorer).
        Specified by:
        mostSimilarItems in interface OryxRecommender
        Parameters:
        itemID - ID of item for which to find most similar other items
        howMany - desired number of most similar items to find
        rescorer - PairRescorer which can adjust item-item similarity estimates used to determine most similar items. The longs that will be passed to the PairRescorer are the candidate item that might be returned in the result as its first element, and the itemID argument here as its second element.
        Returns:
        items most similar to the given item, ordered from most similar to least
        Throws:
        NoSuchItemException - if the item is not known
        NotReadyException

      • mostSimilarItems

        public List<IDValue> mostSimilarItems(String[] itemIDs,
                                      int howMany)
                               throws NoSuchItemException,
                                      NotReadyException
        Like mostSimilarItems(String[], int, PairRescorer) but uses no rescorer.
        Specified by:
        mostSimilarItems in interface OryxRecommender
        Parameters:
        itemIDs - IDs of item for which to find most similar other items
        howMany - desired number of most similar items to find estimates used to determine most similar items
        Returns:

      • mostSimilarItems

        public List<IDValue> mostSimilarItems(String[] itemIDs,
                                      int howMany,
                                      PairRescorer rescorer)
                               throws NoSuchItemException,
                                      NotReadyException
        Computes items most similar to an item or items. The returned items have the highest average similarity to the given items.
        Specified by:
        mostSimilarItems in interface OryxRecommender
        Parameters:
        itemIDs - items for which most similar items are required
        howMany - maximum number of similar items to return; fewer may be returned
        rescorer - rescoring function used to modify item-item similarities before ranking results
        Returns:
        IDValues representing the top recommendations for the user, ordered by quality, descending. The score associated to it is an opaque value. Larger means more similar, but no further interpretation may necessarily be applied.
        Throws:
        NoSuchItemException - if any of the items is not known in the model
        NotReadyException - if the recommender has no model available yet

      • similarityToItem

        public float[] similarityToItem(String toItemID,
                                String... itemIDs)
                         throws NotReadyException,
                                NoSuchItemException
        Specified by:
        similarityToItem in interface OryxRecommender
        Parameters:
        toItemID - item to calculate similarity to
        itemIDs - items to calculate similarity from
        Returns:
        similarity of each item to the given. The values are opaque; higher means more similar.
        Throws:
        NoSuchItemException - if none of itemIDs exist in the model or if toItemID does not exist. Otherwise, unknown items are ignored.
        NotReadyException

      • recommendedBecause

        public List<IDValue> recommendedBecause(String userID,
                                        String itemID,
                                        int howMany)
                                 throws NoSuchUserException,
                                        NoSuchItemException,
                                        NotReadyException

        Lists the items that were most influential in recommending a given item to a given user. Exactly how this is determined is left to the implementation, but, generally this will return items that the user prefers and that are similar to the given item.

        These values by which the results are ordered are opaque values and have no interpretation other than that larger means stronger.

        Specified by:
        recommendedBecause in interface OryxRecommender
        Parameters:
        userID - ID of user who was recommended the item
        itemID - ID of item that was recommended
        howMany - maximum number of items to return
        Returns:
        List of IDValue, ordered from most influential in recommended the given item to least
        Throws:
        NoSuchUserException - if the user is not known in the model
        NoSuchItemException - if the item is not known in the model
        NotReadyException - if the recommender has no model available yet

        Throws:

        Specified by:
        getMostActiveUsers in interface OryxRecommender
        Parameters:
        howMany - how many users to return
        Returns:
        List of user IDValues, ordered from the most number of interaction with distinct items to least.
        Throws:
        NotReadyException - if the implementation has no usable model yet

      • isReady

        public boolean isReady()
        Specified by:
        isReady in interface OryxRecommender
        Returns:
        true if and only if the instance is ready to make recommendations; may be false for example while the recommender is still building an initial model

      • await

        public void await()
           throws InterruptedException
        Description copied from interface: OryxRecommender
        Blocks indefinitely until OryxRecommender.isReady() returns true.
        Specified by:
        await in interface OryxRecommender
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted while waiting
